intro: Commicarpus sinuatus, commonly known as the sinuous thornapple, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Commicarpus sinuatus is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
